I would recommend this game if you plan to play with friends. The game is bitter-sweet, with one match frustrating you and making you mad, while another match you laugh at some stunt you managed to pull off. For example, getting one-shot several rounds in a row vs zeusing someone multiple times. Just remember to beg matchmaking to work in your favor.

I had technical issues and wasn't able to connect to a competitive match within like 3 minutes so it gave me a 2 hour competitive ban. You also can't escape silver. There doesn't seem to be dedicated servers, my friends and I are US and we always get Europeans and Asians who speak broken English, don't know how to play, and don't make/follow call-outs. Otherwise you end up with smurfs on the enemy team. Matchmaking needs a serious revamp.

I'v been playing Counter Strike since 2006, so i consider myself one of the Oldschooler in this Game. Back then  i played with several teams competitive, we were mid class most of the time, attended a few competitions, sometimes even bigger LAn events. Nowadays most teammates are already gone, most of them have families, but surely everyone of us plays now and then.  And because most of the time we only play if we have time, and the real competitive days are already behind us, there's not much left than matchmaking. Sadly, the amount of toxic and cheating players is so damn high than never before, it's easy to spot them with 10+ years experience.. Really sad, that i need to encounter almost every second match with one player like this. This just ruins my Day... But the memories are still there, and i have a love for CS, but i wouldnt recommend this to anyone who tries it as a newbie.
